thread.title: Harry Styles wears wrist bandage as he steps out in London
thread.title_full: Harry Styles wears wrist bandage as he steps out in London | Daily Mail Online

author: Jessica Rach For Mailonline
title: Harry Styles wears wrist bandage as he steps out in London
text:
His first solo album is reportedly on the brink of being released.
But Harry Styles sported a painful looking wrist bandage as he was spotted out in London on Monday.
The One Direction star, 23, appeared in good spirits despite his injury.
Scroll down for video
Reocurring injury? Harry Styles, 23, sported a painful looking bandage as he was spotted out in London on Monday
Harry was last seen sporting a bandage on his right wrist in July 2016 after weeks of filming his acting debut in Dunkirk in the Netherlands and France-suggesting it's a reoccurring injury.
Dressed in sporty attire including shorts a grey hoodie and trainers, the singer added a black beanie for warmth.
And carrying a holdall and a coat as he headed to his car, it looked as though the British star had enjoyed a visit to the gym.
Mailonline has contacted his representative for comment.
Support: The One Direction star was last seen sporting a bandage on his right wrist in July 2016 after weeks of filming his acting debut in Dunkirk
Meanwhile fans of the heartthrob will no doubt be sent into even more of a frenzy as it has now emerged that Harry Styles' solo album is 'not far away' from its debut.
Rob Stringer, the CEO of Columbia Records, confirmed in an interview to Billboard on Thursday that the singer, 23, is very 'close' to releasing his first solo record - which he goes on to describe as 'authentic'.
The record executive, 54, revealed to the music site that Harry's first solo venture was nearly finished, and fast approaching its release.
He said: 'We're close and we're very excited. We have a record we're incredibly excited about and itâ€™s not far away from being ready.'
Admitting that both he and the Cheshire native wanted to ensure the music was of the highest quality before it is unveiled to fans, he continued: 'We obviously want everything to be beautifully done, because we think he's here to stay.'
The chairman also revealed that the album will be worth the wait, as Harry has worked hard to pour his heart into the songs to make them original and genuine.
'Harry has stepped up with the vision of someone who's authentic,' Stringer added.
Having risen to fame as one fifth of One Direction, the singer has embarked on a number of solo projects since the band temporarily disbanded in January last year.
Paving his own path: One fifth of One Direction, the singer has embarked on a number of solo projects since the band temporarily disbanded in January last year
